Vets.gov Products for 508 Testing

OBSOLETE: See A11Y and 508 Best Practices and Launch Guidelines

All Vets.gov products must be fully tested for 508 compliance in accordance with our agreement with the 508 office.

Product Managers are responsible for ensuring the following are completed on new products and when significant changes are made to existing products.

During design & development:

  • Designers are designing with accessibility in mind and engineers are coding with accessibility in mind.
  • Manual color contrast validation and screen reader testing to ensure proper coding and usability (managed by designers and developers).
  • Consult with the 508 office at VACO. Contact Jamie Farber (Jamie.Farber@va.gov) to set up a time and cc: Suzanne Chapman and Raquel Romano.

During deployment:

  • Automated checks occur via Deque (managed by Raquel Romano).

On staging or after launch:

  • Full review by Chris Walker & Dan Diddle at the VA 508 office. Chris & Dan will each team's products on a rotating bases and then have a call with each team to describe issues. Any issues reported should be resolved over the following month and results reported back to them (coordinated by Suzanne Chapman and Raquel Romano via monthly call).

The following list was shared with the 508 reviewers on May 1, 2017 to track progress on reviews.

Product list organized by Team for sharing with 508 Office

Note: items that say “(auth)” can only be accessed on staging and with a test user account. Nothing else requires use of a test account but if you want to actually submit a form, please only do so from staging.
